verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; set to Muth-labben. A Psalm of David. I will give thanks <WH3034> unto Jehovah <WH3068> with my whole heart <WH3820>; I will show forth <WH5608> all thy marvellous works <WH6381>.
I will be glad <WH8055> and exult <WH5970> in thee <WH2167>; I will sing praise to thy name <WH8034>, O thou Most High <WH5945>.
When mine enemies <WH341> turn <WH7725> back <WH268>, They stumble <WH3782> and perish <WH6> at thy presence <WH6440>.
For thou hast maintained <WH6213> my right <WH4941> and my cause <WH1779>; Thou sittest <WH3427> in the throne <WH3678> judging <WH8199> righteously <WH6664>.
Thou hast rebuked <WH1605> the nations <WH1471>, thou hast destroyed <WH6> the wicked <WH7563>; Thou hast blotted out <WH4229> their name <WH8034> for ever <WH5769> and ever <WH5703>.

The enemy <WH341> are come to an end <WH8552>, they are desolate <WH2723> for ever <WH5331>; And the cities <WH6145> which thou hast overthrown <WH5428>, The very remembrance <WH2143> of them <WH1992> is perished <WH6>.
But Jehovah <WH3068> sitteth <WH3427> as king for ever <WH5769>: He hath prepared <WH3559> his throne <WH3678> for judgment <WH4941>;
And he will judge <WH8199> the world <WH8398> in righteousness <WH6664>, He will minister judgment <WH1777> to the peoples <WH3816> in uprightness <WH4339>.
Jehovah <WH3068> also will be a high tower <WH4869> for the oppressed <WH1790>, A high tower <WH4869> in times <WH6256> of trouble <WH6869>;
And they that know <WH3045> thy name <WH8034> will put their trust <WH982> in thee <WH3068>; For thou, Jehovah, hast not forsaken <WH5800> them that seek thee <WH1875>.
Sing praises <WH2167> to Jehovah <WH3068>, who dwelleth <WH3427> in Zion <WH6726>: Declare <WH5046> among the people <WH5971> his doings <WH5949>.
For he that maketh inquisition <WH1875> for blood <WH1818> remembereth <WH2142> them <WH7911>; He forgetteth not the cry <WH6818> of the poor <WH6035>.

Have mercy <WH2603> upon me <WH3068>, O Jehovah; Behold <WH7200> my affliction <WH6040> which I suffer of them that hate <WH8130> me <WH7311>, Thou that liftest me up from the gates <WH8179> of death <WH4194>;
That I may show forth <WH5608> all thy praise <WH8416>. In the gates <WH8179> of the daughter <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726> I will rejoice <WH1523> in thy salvation <WH3444>.
The nations <WH1471> are sunk down <WH2883> in the pit <WH7845> that they made <WH6213>: In the net <WH7568> which <WH2098> they hid <WH2934> is their own foot <WH7272> taken <WH3920>.

Jehovah <WH3068> hath made himself known <WH3045>, he hath executed <WH6213> judgment <WH4941>: The wicked <WH7563> is snared <WH5367> in the work <WH6467> of his own hands <WH3709>. [Higgaion <WH1902>. Selah <WH5542>]
The wicked <WH7563> shall be turned <WH7725> back unto Sheol <WH7585>, Even all the nations <WH1471> that forget <WH7913> God <WH430>.
For the needy <WH34> shall not alway <WH5331> be forgotten <WH7911>, Nor the expectation <WH8615> of the poor <WH6041> perish <WH6> for ever <WH5703>.
Arise <WH6965>, O Jehovah <WH3068>; Let not man <WH582> prevail <WH5810>: Let the nations <WH1471> be judged <WH8199> in thy sight <WH6440>.
Put <WH7896> them in fear <WH4172>, O Jehovah <WH3068>: Let the nations <WH1471> know <WH3045> themselves to be but men <WH582>. [Selah <WH5542>]
